description.narrative: Mejorar la protección y la conservación de la biodiversidad en el corredor Amboró Madidi, a través de una gestión sostenible de los bosques, basándose en fomentar mercados para productos forestales certificados y para incrementar los ingresos locales.
seat of government of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: El proyecto implementó sus actividades en el Norte del Departamento de La Paz, en la zona de influencia del Corredor de Conservación Madidi - Amboró (CAM). Las acciones operativas se implementaron una superficie de 51.607.45 Km2 (Ixiamas Guanay, Mapiri, Teoponte, Alto Beni, Palos Blancos y San Buena

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Communities with strengthened capacities to obtain and keep certification and manage forests in a sustainable and biodiversityfriendly way
Number of communities participating in the project and trained in BD management to apply safeguard measures in accordance with BD protection best practices defined in the management plan guidelines

comment.narrative:
a 0 Communities participating in project
b 0 monitoring record sheets filled out autonomously by the communities

a 20 CFEs applying the BD monitoring system
b 20 monitoring record sheets per year filled out autonomously by the communities in three years up to year 4

The implementation of the several planning instruments is allowing to develop areas with long term monitoring
The project is developing training and technical assistance to municipalities for the development of activities of Integrated Management of Forests and biodiversity monitoring
With the study of the productive potential for the Leco Larecajas and OFCs from the Tacana Indigenous People monitoring sites will be available for the integrated forest management and BD conservation

description.narrative:
Increase in number of forest communities receiving support to apply the forest management plans prevent and reduce fires increase control over their territory and move towards certification
a Number of communities with forest management plans
b Number of communities with forest certification
c of TCO and extension with indigenous territory management plans

comment.narrative:
a 14 communities with management plans or with POAF Two communities have management plans for NTFP Majo and Incienso in Ixiamas and Madidi
b To date there is a single community in the process of FSC certification under the regency scheme but it is outside AMC 2 ASLs in AMC have FSC certification under regency with Ecolegno Zero communities with NTFP certified in AMC
c One TCO has indigenous territory management plans finalized and one has remained half done Implementation is partial There is no territorial control strategy

a 8 additional CFEs with forest management plans and 5 additional CFEs have NTFP management plans
b 5 communities in AMC joint communities of CIPTA with FSC certification for wood products 5 communities with another type of certification for NTFP
c 20 communities participate in preparing the strategy of territorial protection against illegal logging activities and apply it on 100000 ha

The Project along with ABT is promoting the development of Forest and Land Integrated Management Plans PGIBT in northern La Paz aimed to intercultural areas in the municipalities of Palos Blancos Alto Beni and Guanay
Nine communities of the Tacana Indigenous People will access the national forest certification ABT with the option to further access the FSC certification for which Project is giving technical assistance

b 5 communities in AMC joint communities of CIPTA with FSC certification for wood products 5 communities with another type of certification for NTFP

description.narrative:
Forest area conserved through biodiversityfriendly forest management certified following a stepwise approach including participation in
a Forest management plan
b Forest management plan andor FSC simplified certification
c Forest Stewardship Council FSC certification
d NTFP certification

comment.narrative:
a 74705 hectares under forest management plans mostly private companies
b Integral forest certification does not exist yet
c 0 ha managed by communities under FSC certification

a 30000 new hectares with management plans at community level
b At least 5 pilot communities 15000 has with management plans
c At least 10000 has of community forests certified with FSC standards
d At least 50 of 5000 hectares under management receive international NTFP certification

Out of the 300000 ha under the schemes of timber and nontimber forest management planned for the first semester of 2016 50 will be reached
9 Tacana communities 2 Leco Larecaja communities and over 10 intercultural communities develop integrated forest management activities including timber and nontimber products

b At least 5 pilot communities 15000 has with management plans

description.narrative: Economic incentives are in place to attract and keep community forestry operations committed to sustainable forestry and BD management practices

Increase in demand for certified products measured via
a of certified communities sales to certified buyers
b of chainofcustody certifications involving communities
c of alliances resulting in sales contracts between communities and international or national buyers specifically demanding certified forest products
d of national markets for products sourced from certified forests including Government demand
e Certified volumes sold

comment.narrative:
a 32 of certified sales to certified buyers
b 0 chain of custody certification involving communities
c 0 new alliances facilitated by project
d 0 national markets for products sourced from certified forests there is no law to foster the purchase of certified products
e 3172 M3 of certified wood in custody sold to the national market

a 50 of certified communities sales to certified buyers
b Two new chains of custody established in the intervention area
c Six alliances between communities and the next links in the chain consolidated allowing for better revenues to communities
d 4 new markets opened for NTFP with valueadded
e At least 50000 M3 of certified or verified wood sold in the national or international market

Efforts have been developed to achieve ABT national certification the International FSC certification or FLEGT through the development of courses workshops and cross cutting training with several communities
The certification process aims to fulfill the following a source of origin b certification of transport c certification of processing centers which in total is the chain of custody
A sawmill will be implemented in the territory of the Tacana Indigenous People to solve the transformation and valueadded to some 45000 ha of timber generated by forest clearings under legal schemes in areas designated by the Government to sugarcane cultivation through the Bolivian Forest Enterprise EASBA
There is the request from the Ministry of Planning and the Forestry Department to assist in the formation of the Bolivian Forest Enterprise in northern La Paz To that end the OFCs of the Tacana Indigenous People may provide processed wood from their sawmill to EASBA

a 50 of certified communities sales to certified buyers
b Two new chains of custody established in the intervention area
c Six alliances between communities and the next links in the chain consolidated allowing for better revenues to communities
d 4 new markets opened for NTFP with valueadded
e At least 50000 M3 of certified or verified wood sold in the national or international market

description.narrative: Improve protection and conservation of biodiversity in the Amboró Madidi corridor through sustainable forest management based on fostering markets for certified forest products and increase in local revenues
Level of participation of women and men in operations of CFEs in project impact study sites

comment.narrative: TBD once the gender indicators are agreed upon participants
30 average increase participation of women in CFE operations

Terms of Reference for the project engineering are ready for the following
Five women entrepreneurship
An azai processing center in Ixiamas
A majo processing center in Guanay
A natural rubber collection center in Guanay
A wood processing center in Tumupasa
The Moseten Indigenous People has been incorporated in the project to support women entrepreneurs
Strategic alliances with specialized institutions were set up to promote commercialization of products produced by Lecos Tacana and Mosetenes indigenous and intercultural peoples

description.narrative:
Increase in Community Forestry Enterprises CFEs dedicating resources to biodiversity conservation and implementing specific measures related to biodiversity measured as
a of communities that apply the biodiversity monitoring system
b ha under forest management plans
c of indicator species that maintain their populations at landscape level
d Rate of change in forest floral diversity proxy for overall BD in project impact study site
e Rate of deforestation and degradation in project impact study sites
f Areas setaside and under strict protection measures

comment.narrative:
There are at least 3 experiences in biodiversity monitoring FAN WCS and Instituto de Ecología None adapted to the context of the communities
a 0 communities monitor biodiversity
b 160000 ha
c Decreasing numbers in populations
d TBD once the BD monitoring system is finalized
e TBD once the local team are equipped functional and able to monitor effectively deforestation
f 32000ha

Midterm
a 40 communities are trained to apply the BD monitoring system that has been prepared and approved by the government
End of project
a 20 communities apply the BD monitoring system in their managed forest areas
b 25000 additional ha under timber forest management plans mainly in Ixiamas and 5000 ha under nontimber forest management plans mainly in Guanay
c BD monitoring system shows that populations of jaguar Panthera onca white lipped peccary Tajasu tajaco and spider monkey Ateles paniscus are stable
d lt10 of plots with declining forest floral diversity in certified sites
101010
10e 0 deforestation in certified sites
f 6000 ha 20 of total certified forestland apply setasides and protection plans and strict safeguard measures for the protection of biodiversity with support from GEF and 3000 with support of partners

The design of the BD Monitoring System is completed Although the implementation criteria is being currently developed thorough consultation processes with the municipalities the Autonomous Government of La Paz and the Envirnoment Vice Ministry
Complementing the BD Monitoring System the Project concluded through a consultancy the elaboration of the Life System Document for the Tacana Indigenous People CIPTA and the Life System Document for the Leco Larecaja Indigenous People PILCOL which is being developed by Project consultants has been completed in 40 All of this work has been done framed in Mother Earth Law No 300
The two main Projects direct beneficiaries Leco Larecajas and Tacanas Indigenous People already have a Land Management instrument to ascribe to the Adaptation and Mitigation Forest Joint Mechanism as an incentive system
The 10 Community Forestry Organizations working with the Project covering timber and nontimber land is superior to 120000 ha
20 of training monitoring and implementation activities on National Certification as a mandatory element in Bolivia are being developed in coordination with the representatives of the Tacana Indigenous People CIPTA the Council for Voluntary Forest Certification CFV the Council of Indigenous Peoples of Bolivia CEPILAB and the municipalities of San Buenaventura and Ixiamas
The Carmen Pecha Tacanas community has been trained on the use of palm fruit tree Acai Euterpe precatoria with the support of TCO Porvenir Indigenous People of Santa Cruz Department in the horizontal training modality The community is applying this knowledge
An area of 12800 ha in under a forest management plan for timber and nontimber products in Carmen Pecha Community
300 ha of palm fruit tree Acai Euterpe precatoria already have a management plan endorsed by the competent authority ABT
Terms of Reference to update the Management Plan PGM for the use of palm tree Majo Oenocarpus bataua covering an area of 400 ha in the community of Pajonal Vilaque Leco Larecaja Indigenous PeoplePILCOL is ready
Training activities were already design to be delivered in 3 communities of the Leco Larecaja Indigenous People PILCOL for the use of natural rubber Hevea brasiliensis
Terms of Reference to develop the PGIBT to improve the Intercultural Entrepreneurship Network and Indigenous Women placed in the municipalities of Palos Blanco and Alto Beni is ready To this end Project is also supporting five productive entrepreneurships to transform fruits from the forest and agroforestry systems which are sold to diverse municipalities to be used in school breakfast Four of these intercultural entrepreneurship add 1000 women and the fifth one belong to the Moseten indigenous people benefiting 200 women

Midterm
a 40 communities are trained to apply the BD monitoring system that has been prepared and approved by the government
End of project

b 25000 additional ha under timber forest management plans mainly in Ixiamas and 5000 ha under nontimber forest management plans mainly in Guanay
c BD monitoring system shows that populations of jaguar Panthera onca white lipped peccary Tajasu tajaco and spider monkey Ateles paniscus are stable
d lt10 of plots with declining forest floral diversity in certified sites
101010
10e 0 deforestation in certified sites

description.narrative:
Increase in competitiveness of communities enabling greater investments in BD conservation measured through
a Increase in communities revenues
b Increased investment allocated to BD monitoring

comment.narrative:
a US8000 to 20000 annual income
b 0 of incomes invested in BD monitoring

a Increase of 15 in revenues of communities that work with timber and 20 in those that work with NTFP over traditional market
b 25 of communities invest 5 of their incomes in BD

Out of the seven municipalities covered by the project 5 confirmed the necessity of working with the project and work plans are being developed jointly to incorporate biodiversity conservation and integrated forest management in their instruments of economic development
The project has initiated training to local authorities to implement the mechanism of management and conservation of forests and biodiversity
The articulation process with national authorities such as Mother Earth Plurinational Authority APMT Forestry Department DGGDF Forestry National Fund FONABOSQUE Forests and Land Authority of Supervision and Social Control of ABT has been set up to develop forest and BD conservation and activities through work plans jointly elaborated
The Environment ViceMinistry VMA fully supports the project
Out of the six cofinanciers four have ratified and rescheduled their work with the project FONABOSQUE ABT APMT INIAF
There is a base line on family income for TCO Leco LarecajaPILCOL although there are communities with more needs than others
The Guanay Municipality has shown its interest to incorporate measures to conserve its BD

description.narrative: Institutional support mechanisms are generated to foster conservation of biodiversity through sustainable forest management and certification

Technical support team for forest certification operational
a of municipal forest management and development plans formulated and tied to the municipal plans PDM
b of PDMs that include chapters and elements on BD monitoring
c of internal technical audit teams forestry in operation for the Ixiamas area ABT MFUs NGOs
d of technical audits to support CFEs in the process of obtaining certification

comment.narrative:
a 0 municipal forest management and development plans formulated and tied to the PDM MFUs with low budget allocations and isolated projects
b 0 municipal plans PDM that include chapters and elements on BD monitoring
c There are no internal auditing services in the CFEs ASLs or TCOs
d 0 technical audits to support CFEs in certification processes absence of knowledge about certification processes

a Three municipal forest management and development plans formulated and tied to the PDM
b Municipal plans PDM include chapters and elements on BD monitoring
c An internal technical auditing team forestry in operation for the Ixiamas area ABT UFM NGOs
d 15 technical audits to support CFEs in the process of obtaining certification

In municipalities of Guanay Teoponte and Mapiri as well as in the municipalities of San Buenaventura and Ixiamas the Project is promoting the Integrated Forest Management through its Municipal Land Management Plans
There is the request from the Municipality of Guanay to develop its Life System which is in feasibility analysis
The Municipality of Guanay requested the Project support in the revision of its Municipal Development Plan PDM to incorporate Biodiversity and gender criteria as a result of Projects PDMs review
The Project is setting up working groups for the integrated management of forests and BD with ABT municipalities and TCO which are the relevant mechanism of driving forces and social control in both projects working areas In these working groups the Project is shaping strategies for the control and supervision in the northern area of La Paz Department in order to reduce timber traffic and illegal deforestation
ABT through Project support has increased its working team by 4 technicians who receive continuous technical assistance to develop strategies for national forest certificación
ABT for its operative work counts on 3 motorcycles and computer equipment to improve their forest management capabilities
A bidding process is in place for the identification of the productive potential of the Leco Larecajas territory

b Municipal plans PDM include chapters and elements on BD monitoring
c An internal technical auditing team forestry in operation for the Ixiamas area ABT UFM NGOs

Reduced illegal logging in the project intervention area
a Rate of illegal deforestation in the project zone
b of seizures of wood in the project zone
c mobile teams operating

a 100 of deforestation is illegal 2007
b 160 seizures of wood in the project implementation region in 2009
c 0 mobile teams in the project region

a 30 reduction in illegal deforestation in the project intervention area
b By midterm the effectiveness of operations against illegal wood has increased 40
c Two mobile inspection teams established trained and operational

Terms of Reference were published for the formulation of 4 Integrated forest Management Plans in the Lecos Larecajas indigenous people land for an extension of 2500 has to develop management and use of nontimber products as an strategy for reducing the advance of the agricultural and livestock frontier
At the moment through 4 women intercultural entrepreneurships in Alto Beni and Palos Blancos support is being delivered to add value to forest products and agroforestry systems Also in the same region support is being provided to a group of Mosetenes Women OMIN that with the support of their husbands OPIN are managing their forest in a sustainable way and adding value to their nontimber products in order to reduce deforestation and the loss of forest coverage
A joint work plan with ABT has been developed Through Project support 3 forestry technicians incorporated in ABT team to increase control of wood harvest They also worked to generate information on ilegal logging in Ixiamas y San Buenaventura Palos Blancos and Alto Beni
3 technical data reports on exploited forest species mostly used species also related to illegal logging

description.narrative:
Legal regulatory and operational frameworks facilitate BD protection in the AMC area
a Protection of BD is incorporated as a requirement of comprehensive forest management
b BD monitoring tool is developed validated and included as requirement in the operational plan of comprehensive forest management
c National policy to promote procurement of certified forest products
d NTFP management plan standards

comment.narrative:
a There is a national Comprehensive Forest Management plan no operational plan
b There are at least 3 examples of BD monitoring systems but not adapted for use in communities
c There is no national policy prioritizing purchase of certified products
d There are two standards for NTFP Brazil nut and Aíai Palm

Midterm
a Proposal of an operating plan for the Comprehensive Forest Management plan including a proposal adopted by the government
b Simplified FSC certification standard approved by the FSC
End of project
c Operating plan for Comprehensive Forest Management effectively integrates guidelines for BD protection and the implementation of a BD monitoring tool
d A national policy that prioritizes purchase of certified products is approved and implemented in at least two municipalities
e At least two standards for management plans approved for other NTFP

Sector Plan for Integrated Forest Management formulated in 30 as support to the Forestry Department VMA
A training plan developed with the Bolivian Council for Voluntary Forest Certification CFVFSC for training in the FSC and the simplified ABT Simplified Certification of Bolivia
Training of 9 Forestry Community Organizations OFCs from the Tacana Indigenous People on FSC and ABT Certification
Micro zoning of the Tacana Indigenous People Land is available to apply the Life System recomendations
The Monitoring System with baseline and indicators to be applied in the 6 production chains that promotes and supports the project is ready
Agreements with institutions that promote the sustainable use of forests under mitigation schemes to threats caused by the San Buenaventura Ixiamas road the San BuenaventuraRurrenabaque Bridge and the San Buenaventura Sugar Company EASBA
There is a work plan with the Mother Earth Plurinational Authority to incorporate timber and non timber entrepreneurships in the Adaptation and Mitigation Joint Mechanisms to promote the sustainable use of forests
A Forest Management Plan for 12800 ha has been approved for the sustainable use of Acai fruits Euterpe precatoria in Carmen Pecha community Tacana Indigenous People
Workshops were conducted in 20 of the 33 communities of Lecos Larecaja Indigenous People to build their Life System Document according to Mother Earth Law 300
Work is underway to update the management plan in 200 ha to harvest majo fruit Oenocarpus bataua in the community of Pajonal Vilaque Leco Larecaja Indigenous People

Midterm
a Proposal of an operating plan for the Comprehensive Forest Management plan including a proposal adopted by the government
b Simplified FSC certification standard approved by the FSC
End of project
c Operating plan for Comprehensive Forest Management effectively integrates guidelines for BD protection and the implementation of a BD monitoring tool
d A national policy that prioritizes purchase of certified products is approved and implemented in at least two municipalities
e At least two standards for management plans approved for other NTFP

description.narrative: 1. Incremento de empresas de silvicultura (CFEs) que asignen recursos a la conservación de la BD e implementen medidas específicas relacionadas a la biodiversidad, medibles como a) # de comunidades que aplican el sistema de monitoreo de la BD, B) # de has. sujetas a planes de gestión forestal, c) # de indicadores de especies que mantienen sus poblaciones a nivel del paisaje, d) tasa de cambio en la diversidad floral del bosque en el sitio de estudio de impacto del proyecto, e) tasa de deforestación y degradación en los sitios de estudio de impacto del proyecto, f) áreas destinadas bajo estrictas medidas de protección. 2. Incremento en la competitividad de las comunidades que permite mayores inversiones en la conservación de la BD, medido a través de: a) incremento en los ingresos de las comunidades; b) incremento de inversiones en medidas de monitoreo de la BD. 3. Nivel de participación de mujeres y hombres en las operaciones de las CFEs en los sitios de estudio de impacto del proyecto.

comment.narrative: Existen por lo menos 3 experiencias de monitoreo de la BD (FAN, WCS e Instituto de Ecología), ninguna adaptada al contexto de comunidades

Se capacitan 20 comunidades en el uso de sistemas de monitoreo de la biodiversidad. Las comunidades apoyan a los emprendimientos productivos de producción maderable y no maderable. Se cuantifica y categoriza la gestión de áreas bajo manejo forestal maderable y no maderable. Se realiza una colaboración interinstitucional entre las direcciones. Se cuantifica el monitoreo de las parcelas permanentes. Se promueven acciones de conservación de diferentes formas en el área del proyecto. Se realizan ferias y mesas de negociación. Se desarrollan actividades para implementar el fondo rotativo. El proyecto desarrolla 6 EDIM - B para municipios. El proyecto promueve el desarrollo de las EDI para las comunidades indígenas.

25 comunidades fueron capacitadas en el monitoreo de la biodiversidad con planes forestales de productos no maderables y maderables. En 18 comunidades se aplica el sistema de monitoreo de biodiversidad. Se ha logrado manejar 71868,39 Ha están bajo manejo forestal. Colaboración a la DGGDF en el desarrollo e implementación del módulo de biodiversidad en el bosque a través de la web site: http://simb.siarh.gob.bo/simb/ 4 monitoreos fueron establecidos en el área del proyecto sin cambios reportados. Se han alcanzado tres acciones definidas de conservación, el establecimiento de una reserva híidrica de 934 Ha; 4590 Ha bajo manejo de no maderables; 26911 bajo manejo forestal. Los emprendimientos productivos se han visto fortalecidos con capacidades, producción efectiva, participación en ferias y mesas de negociación. Se proveyeron equipos y capacitación a 11 emprendimientos productivos, de estos 11 el 45% tiene un ingreso superior de 25%. 6 OFC apoyadas por el proyecto apoyan al menos 125 socios de los cuales 40 son mujeres. El proyecto desarrolló 3 EDI para PILCOL y Tacana y San José de Uchupamonas. El proyecto desarrolló 6 EDIM - B para los municipios del proyecto. No se logran resultados en la implementación del fondo rotativo
